content: side purl to the stitch indicated by the pattern and turn the work so the right side is facing bring the yarn to the front between the needle and slip the first stitch from the left needle to the right needle purlwise with the yarn in front pull the yarn to the back of the work over top of the right needle this will distort the stitch making it look as if there are 2 stitches instead of 1 your yarn is now in the correct position to knit the next stitch but remember to keep firm gauge on the yarn for this stitch when you are ready to resume knitting in the round you will knit the two legs of all your double stitches together as if they are one stitch instructions using the smaller size needles and your preferred cast on method i used the long tail method cast on 108 112 112 116 120 sts place marker and then join in the round being careful not to twist this marker is the beginning of the round for the entire body of the sweater and is placed at the centre back round 1 *k1tbl p1 repeat from * across the round this forms a twisted rib pattern where k1tbl means to the knit the stitch stitch in the back of the loop repeat this round 6 more times first increase round *k2 m1l repeat from * across round to give 162 168 168 174 180 sts change to larger needle and knit one round short row section row 1 rs k52 55 55 58 60 turn work and make ds row 2 ws purl to marker sm p 52 55 55 58 60 turn work and make ds row 3 rs k to marker sm k to 5 sts before last ds turns work and make ds row 4 ws purl to marker sm purl to 5 sts before last ds turn work make ds repeat last 2 row 3 more times next round knit to marker sm knit across round knitting the two legs of each ds together when you come to them the stitch count will not change yoke the next two rounds will form the chain pattern always slip your stitches purlwise with the yarn in front wyif of your work so that it will cross in front of the slipped stitch round 1 *s1 wyif p1 repeat from * across round round 2 *p1 s1 wyif repeat from * across round rounds 3-6 knit rounds 7-8 repeat rounds 1 and 2 round 9 second increase round in this and following increase rounds use the knit front and back into the same stitch to make the increases as this will blend in better with the chain stitch sizes xs k1 kfb 4 times *k2 kfb k1 kfb repeat from * to last 4 sts k1 kfb 2 times 228 sts size s *k1 kfb k1 kfb k2 kfb repeat from
